thread.title: Wildcat runners compete in new venue
thread.title_full: Wildcat runners compete in new venue

author: Matt Henry Midway Driller Sports Writer mhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com
title: Wildcat runners compete in new venue
text: Wildcat runners compete in new venue Nine schools take part in meet at Kern County Raceway Comment Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA By Matt Henry Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:57 PM By Matt Henrymhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com Posted Oct. 5, 2015 at 12:57 PM Kern County Raceway Park is well known for car racing but a different type of racing took place on the track Saturday morning when four high school races were held as part of the 11th annual Black-Gold Rush. “There were a number of personal bests set on this course as well as individual awards,” said Taft coach Ryan Hickman. Each of the races were set up where the runners would go around a portion of the track before heading out through a tunnel. The runners went around a dirt track before heading back through the tunnel on to the track and the finish line. JV boys As a team, the Wildcats finished fourth out of eight teams with 124 points. John Connick was third overall with a personal best time of 18:00. Carlos Cibrian was 44th with a time of 21:08.68 while Rodolfo Magana was 45th with a time of 21:09.78. Varsity boys As a team, the Wildcats finished third out of nine teams with 98 points. Individually, Alejandro Quinonez was ninth with a time of 17:16 while Seth Bullard was 12th overall with a time of 17:31. Andres Camacho was 22nd with a time of 18:07.69.Elijiah Cortez was 26th with a time of 18:38.56. Moises Ruiz was 31st with a time of 19:07.09. Varsity girls The Lady Wildcats had only three runners compete in the race and as a result did not have a team score. Individually, Jeydi Santiago had the best time among the runners by coming in 14th with a time of 23:18. Kylie Campbell followed with a time of 23:49 and 19th. Hannah Covington was 25th with a time of 24:18.62. The Wildcats are off for two weeks before returning to action Saturday, Oct. 17 when they compete in the Rebel Invitational at Hart Park. By Matt Henry
